title: Bloodstone Snuff Box, "Bloodstone snuff box", ca. 1750
markings: On inside rim of box: 1) Paris maker's mark, indecipherable, 2) ox head, Paris mark of charge under Julien Berth, 1750-1756, 3) crowned italic K, warden's mark for 1750-1757; On rims of both covers marks struck twice: 4) eagle's head with single outline, Paris mark for gold, restriced warranty, 1838-1847, 5) anvil, or reverse, mark, struck at same time as 4.
description: Pouch shape, with two hinged covers and two compartments; plaques of heliotrope held in a frame of gold carved with scrolls, leaves and pinecone motifs; thumb-piece of foliate scrolls set with small diamonds, rubies, and emeralds; sides of box lined with gold.

tombstone.epitaph:
Bloodstone Snuff Box, "Bloodstone snuff box", ca. 1750.
ca. 1750. Bloodstone, gold, diamonds, rubies, emeralds. Gift of Anonymous Donor. 1967-48-9.
